page.title: 06CONSTANTINE EDUCATION
page.content: The first original school was held at the Parish Vestry from May 1785.The children who went had to pay one half penny a day.Then at Ponjeravah there was a boys school,endowed by the Fox Family opened in 1836.At the church a hall was built. There a girls and infants school was formed and this school was separate from the boys.Meals were served at the Recreational club .Then new plans were drawn upfor a County Primary Schoolwhich was officially openedin 1966.The old schools thus were amalganated into a new school,opened by the Prime Minister H.Wilson.The new school stood in its own grounds at the top end of the village.It had five classrooms, a large halland its own canteen for meals.Later it had its own changing roomsand a heated swimming pool,with a flourishing P.T.A.
